citations.narrative:
Two rabbits are housed in stainless-steel stacked enclosures with slatted floors which are covered with an accumulation
of dust and loose rabbit fur. When discussing cleaning and sanitation with the facility representative, he indicated the cage
pan liners underneath the slatted floors are discarded and replaced weekly; however, the primary stainless-steel
enclosures are only sanitized via power washing every 6 to 12 months. Primary enclosures that are not sanitized properly
may accumulate dust, fecal and urine waste products, and bacterial agents which may contribute to health issues in the
rabbits such as gastrointestinal and respiratory illness. Primary enclosures for rabbits must be sanitized every 30 days by
washing with hot water (180F) and soap or detergent as in a mechanical cage washer, or by washing all soiled surfaces
with a detergent solution followed by a safe and effective disinfectant and rinse, or by cleaning all soiled surfaces with live
steam or flame.
Correct by June 12, 2024 by ensuring primary enclosures for the rabbits are sanitized by one of the methods mentioned
above and remain on a schedule of sanitation that occurs at least once every 30 days.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
